intro: Platanus mexicana var. peltata, commonly known as the Mexican fanwood, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that are typically 15–30 cm in diameter. The tree produces distinctive, spherical fruits that contain one or two seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for urban landscaping.
